Hi John

Thanks for your great style guide. I just wanted to share one observation regarding the controllerAs syntax in conjunction with a $watcher. I found that

$scope.$watch( ‘vm.myVar’, function .. etc

didnt work. What I needed was:

$scope.$watch( function(){ return vm.myVar; }, function .., etc

And furthermore, if I were watching a variable on an injected service, and had referenced the service as a local variable, I needed this:

vm.myService = MyService; $scope.$watch( function(){ return vm.getValue() ), function(){ /* do stuff */ });

vm.getValue = function(){ return vm.myService.getValue() };

Though the watcher worked if I referenced MyService directly.

Anyway, just offering it as a possible amendment to your excellent suggestions.

Thanks
